definition: Settler colonialism is a specific type of colonialism which involves the oppression of indigenous peoples and cultures, typically involving war and genocide.

The policy/practice of extending power or influence over other territories, typically through the use of military, economic, or political force. Imperialism can often be associated with settler colonialism.

The social, economic, and political structures that collectively empower those of white racial backgrounds to maintain dominance over other minority groups. Often used to justify imperialism and settler colonialism.

The worldview which revolves around European culture and events. Eurocentrism implies the superiority of Europe over other territories and cultures. Eurocentrism is strongly related to White Supremacy.
The exaggerated portrayal/depiction of Asia and Asian culture as exotic, mysterious, and inferior to European or Western culture. Orientalism is strongly related to Eurocentrism.
